		Question: who was isaac newton and what did he do
		Answer:
answer: Isaac Newton was an English mathematician, physicist, astronomer, alchemist, theologian, and author who is widely recognized as one of the most influential scientists of all time and a key figure in the scientific revolution. He is best known for his discovery of the laws of motion and universal gravitation, but also made important contributions to optics, mathematics, and natural philosophy.
